frame.name: Chatting
frame.definition:
<def-root>A group of people (the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> or <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> and <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> together) have a conversation. No person is construed as only a speaker or only an addressee. Rather, it is understood that both (or all) participants do some speaking and some listening--the process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal. In this frame, the purpose of the conversation is generally social, rather than specifically to decide something or exchange information, or to quarrel (see Discussion and Quarreling).
<ex>If you ain't got nothin' better to do, <fex name="Interlocutor_1">I</fex> 'd like to <t>shoot</t> <t>the</t> <t>breeze</t> <fex name="Interlocutor_2">with you</fex> <fex name="Duration">for a couple</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Interlocutors">We</fex> used to <t>chat</t> <fex name="Topic">about everything</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutors
FE.definition: <def-root>The group of individuals involved in chatting.</def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutor_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of a conversation, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>. Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole.
<ex><fex name="Interlocutor_1">We</fex> <t>chatted</t> with the guards to distract them from the heist going on right behind them.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutor_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent group of participants in a conversation. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>).
<ex>I gossiped <fex name="Interlocutor_2">with the rest of the choir</fex> for a little while.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the chatting goes on.
<ex>They <t>yakked</t> <fex name="Duration">for hours</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The general subject that the statements of the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> in the conversation pertain to.
<ex>Oh, we <t>gossiped</t> <fex name="Topic">about the management shakedown</fex> a bit.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Language
FE.definition:
<def-root>The language(s) or dialect(s) that a conversation is conducted in.
<ex>They exchanged <t>gossip</t> <fex name="Language">in French</fex> while I sat by, completely ignored.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means_of_communication
FE.definition:
<def-root>The device used by the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> to communicate.
<ex>Don't get excited--after a short <fex name="MOC">telephone</fex> <t>chat</t> with a broker, you 'll have your money.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>What the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> (or <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>) hope to accomplish by chatting.
<ex>We <t>shot</t> <t>the</t> <t>breeze</t> for a couple of hours <fex name="Purpose">just to pass the time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which a chat takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where a chat takes place.
<ex>A bit of lunch-time <t>conversation</t> <fex name="Place">on the veranda</fex> would not be amiss, I hope?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The way that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> succeed in having a conversation.
<ex>Though some of the fellas couldn't hear anymore, we <t>chatted</t> with them <fex name="Means">by sharing a typewriter</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the conversation which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> (or <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>) that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the state of the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> (or <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>) during the conversation.
<ex>We <t>talked</t> for a few minutes, <fex name="Depictive">uncertain about why we were bothering</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: chat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk in a friendly and informal way.

lexUnit.name: banter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the playful and friendly exchange of teasing remarks.

lexUnit.name: colloquy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal conference or conversation.

lexUnit.name: conversation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an informal spoken exchange of news and ideas between two or more people.

lexUnit.name: talk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak in order to give information or express ideas or feelings; converse or communicate by speech.

lexUnit.name: joke.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something to cause amusement

lexUnit.name: gossip.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: casual conversation or unsubstantiated reports about other people

lexUnit.name: yak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk at length about trivial or boring subjects.
